data.enText: the ability to see; the area that you can see from a particular position

data.chText: 视力好 / 极好 / 差 / 模糊 / 正常
data.enText: to have good/perfect/poor/blurred/normal vision
20–20 vision (= the ability to see perfectly)
Cats have good night vision .

data.chText: 这对夫妇离开了她的视野。
data.enText: The couple moved outside her field of vision .
He glimpsed something on the edge of his vision.
an idea or a picture in your imagination

data.chText: 他幻想有一个没有战争的世界。
data.enText: He had a vision of a world in which there would be no wars.

data.chText: 我想象我们完全迷失了方向。
data.enText: I had visions of us getting hopelessly lost.
a dream or similar experience, especially of a religious kind

data.chText: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。
data.enText: The idea came to her in a vision.
the ability to think about or plan the future with great imagination and intelligence
a leader of vision
a person of great beauty or who shows the quality mentioned

data.chText: 她穿着镶白色网眼纱边的衣服美极了。
data.enText: She was a vision in white lace.
a vision of loveliness

data.chText: （电视或影院屏幕的）影像，画面
data.enText: the picture on a television or cinema/movie theater screen
We apologize for the loss of vision.

data.chText: 以上各词均指视力范围、视野。
data.enText: These are all words for the area or distance that you can see from a particular position.
sight
the area or distance that you can see from a particular position

data.chText: 他朝街上望去，一个人也没看见。
data.enText: He looked up the street, but there was no one in sight.

data.chText: 把贵重物品留在车里看不见的地方。
data.enText: Leave any valuables in your car out of sight.
view
( rather formal ) the area or distance that you can see from a particular position
The lake soon came into view.
vision
the area that you can see from a particular position

data.chText: 这对夫妇离开了她的视野。
data.enText: The couple moved outside her field of vision (= total area you can see from a particular position) .

data.chText: view较sight和vision书面化，是其中唯一指视野清晰程度的词：
data.enText: View is more literary than sight or vision . It is the only word for talking about how well you can see.
I didn't have a good sight/vision of the stage.
Vision must always be used with a possessive pronoun.
my/his/her etc. (field of) vision

data.chText: vision不与介词in、into和out of连用，但sight和view常与这些介词连用：
data.enText: It is not used with the prepositions in , into and out of that are very frequent with sight and view .
There was nobody in vision.
A tall figure came into vision.
sight, view or vision?
in/out of sight/view
in/within sight/view of sth
in full/plain sight/view
to come into/disappear from sight/view/sb's vision
to vanish from sight/view
to come in sight/view of sb/sth
to block sb's view/vision
sb's line of sight/vision
sb's field of view/vision

simple_means.memory_skill: vis 看 + ion 表名词 → 视力；眼界

ex.chText: 这会导致失明或视力严重受损。
ex.enText: It causes blindness or serious loss of vision.

ex.chText: 20分钟之后，那辆车离开了她的视野。
ex.enText: Twenty minutes later, the car moved outside her field of vision.

synonyms.bx: 指人的视力或目力所及的范围。

ex.chText: 那个小孩的视力有问题。
ex.enText: There was a problem with the child's eyesight.

ex.chText: 哪种动物的视力最敏锐？
ex.enText: Which animal has the keenest eyesight?

synonyms.bx: 尤指眼睛看东西的功能。

ex.chText: 所有小学生都可以免费检查视力。
ex.enText: All students in primary schools can get a free sight/eyesight/vision test.
Just the sight of him made her angry.

synonyms.bx: 表示“视力”时，可与 eyesight, vision 换用；也可指眼睛“看到”这一动作。

tr: the formation of a mental image of something that is not perceived as real and is not present to the senses
example: popular imagination created a world of demons
imagination reveals what the world could be
the runners emerged from the trees into his clear vision
he had a visual sensation of intense light
he had a vision of his own death

tr: a religious or mystical experience of a supernatural appearance
example: he had a vision of the Virgin Mary

value.def: Your vision of a future situation or society is what you imagine or hope it would be like, if things were very different from the way they are now.

example.ex: I have a vision of a society that is free of exploitation and injustice...
example.tran: 我希望建立一个没有剥削和不公的社会。

example.ex: That's my vision of how the world could be...
example.tran: 那是我对未来世界的想象。

example.ex: Turning that vision into a practical reality is not easy.
example.tran: 把那种设想转化为实实在在的现实并非易事。

value.def: If you have a vision of someone in a particular situation, you imagine them in that situation, for example because you are worried that it might happen, or hope that it will happen.

example.ex: He had a vision of Cheryl, slumped on a plastic chair in the waiting-room...
example.tran: 他想象谢里尔瘫坐在候诊室的一把塑料椅子上。

example.ex: Maybe you had visions of being surrounded by happy, smiling children.
example.tran: 也许你曾幻想过被快乐嬉笑的孩子所包围的情景。

value.def: A vision is the experience of seeing something that other people cannot see, for example in a religious experience or as a result of madness or taking drugs.

example.ex: It was on 24th June 1981 that young villagers first reported seeing the Virgin Mary in a vision.
example.tran: 1981年6月24日那天，年轻的村民们首次报告说看到了圣母马利亚的幻象。

value.def: Your vision is your ability to see clearly with your eyes.

example.ex: It causes blindness or serious loss of vision...
example.tran: 这能导致失明或视力严重受损。

example.ex: In spite of his otherwise excellent vision, he found he was colour-blind.
example.tran: 尽管他视力很好，他却发现自己是个色盲。

value.def: Your vision is everything that you can see from a particular place or position.

example.ex: Jane blocked Cross's vision and he could see nothing...
example.tran: 简挡住了克罗斯的视线，他什么也看不见。

example.ex: I saw other indistinct shapes that stayed out of vision.
example.tran: 我看见另有一些模糊的影子晃了一下就不见了。

trans: 复视(将一个物体看成两个影像)
管状视，视野狭窄(只能看正前方的人或物)；一孔之见；井蛙之见
立体视觉；立体视差；立体视；体视；会有立体知觉
周边视觉；周边视力；外围视觉；周围视觉；外围视野
视系统；视觉系统；影像系统；视景系统；图像识别系统
机器视觉；机械视觉；计算机视觉；机器人视觉；机器视觉技术

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 做… + vis 看 + e → 使〔别人〕看到 → 劝告
ad 做… + vis 看 + ory …的 → 劝告的
en 使… + vis 看 + age 表行为 → 看 → 想象
e 出 + vid 看 + ence 性质，状态，行为 → 证据
e 出 + vid 看 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 看出来了 → 明显的
im 不 + provident 深谋远虑的 → 没有远见的，有钱就花 → 浪费的
in 使… + vid 看 + ious …的 → 让人看 →〔易〕招嫉妒的
pre 预先 + vis 看 + e → 预先看 → 预知
pro 在前 + vid 看 + e → 提前看好 → 预备
pro 向前 + vid 看 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 向前看的 → 有远见的 → 深谋远虑的
pro 向前 + vision 眼界 + al …的 → 眼前的 → 临时的
re 一再 + vis 看 + e → 一看再看 → 一改再改 → 修正
re 一再 + vis 看 + ion，revise 的名词 → 修正；校订本
super 上 + vis 看 + e → 在上面看 → 监督
vis 看 + ible 可…的 → 可见的
vis 看 + ion 表名词 → 视力；眼界
vision 视力；眼界 + ary …的 → 幻想的
vis 看 + ual 有…性质的 → 视力的
visual 视力的 + ize …化 → 使〔大家〕看到 → 使具体化
de 加强 + vis 分开 + e → 由古义“分开”转化而来
di 二 + vid 分开 + e → 一分为二 → 分开
di 二，两 + vis 分开 + ion 表名词 → 分开
di 二，两 + vid 分开 + end 表抽象名词 → 一变二，二变多 → 股息
in 不 + di 二，两 + vid 分开 + ual 有…性质的 → 不能分开的 → 个人的
